wackpackr.util

Class ErraticHashTable<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • wackpackr.util.ErraticHashTable<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the class of elements stored in a hash table instance

    public class ErraticHashTable<E>
extends Object
    Very, very limited and "rogue" application of a hash table that distributes elements into buckets by the hash value of their accompanying key, but then tosses the key out the window. This results in some abnormal behaviour: while it is guaranteed that a stored element can be retrieved with the key it is associated with, there is no guarantee that the key retrieves only this element â€” rather, more than one element whose keys just happen to hash to the same bucket may also be retrieved at the same time.

    While the elements can be of any type, and null elements are permitted, specifically only byte sequences (of arbitrary length) are accepted as keys.

    Only two methods are offered: (1) adding an element with a certain key; and (2) retrieving all elements whose keys hash to the same bucket (as described above).

    The backing array is not dynamically resized. Hash table size must be given at instantiation, and remains fixed thereafter. For this reason, this class should not be used unless the maximum number of elements is definitely known in advance, so that the size can be set optimally.

    All things considered, due to its erratic behaviour and laughably limited functionality, this class should not be used unless the caller understands exactly what they're signing up for.

    For hashing, the technique used in String is blatantly copied, because it gives a very uniform distribution with random byte sequences. So, if table size is sensibly set, the operations work in constant time.

    Author:
    Juho Juurinen

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ErraticHashTable(int size)
      Constructs a new, empty hash table.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CircularDoublyLinkedList<E> get(byte... key)
      Returns a list of all elements whose keys hash to the same bucket as the given key.
      void put(E e, byte... key)
      Adds given element to a bucket determined by the hash value of the associated key.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ErraticHashTable

        public ErraticHashTable(int size)
        Constructs a new, empty hash table. Number of buckets (table size) must be given, and is not resized at any later point. Assumption is that caller knows the maximum number of elements to be stored at once, and knows how to pick an optimal size based on the preferred load factor.
        Parameters:
        size - number of buckets in hash table

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public CircularDoublyLinkedList<E> get(byte... key)
        Returns a list of all elements whose keys hash to the same bucket as the given key. If no such elements exist, returns an empty list.
        Parameters:
        key - byte sequence of arbitrary length
        Returns:
        elements in the bucket determined by the hash value of the given key

      • put

        public void put(E e,
                byte... key)
        Adds given element to a bucket determined by the hash value of the associated key.
        Parameters:
        e - element to add to hash table
        key - byte sequence of arbitrary length
